newsitem.title: USA: TJX adjusts Series E stock conversion ratio.
newsitem.headline: TJX adjusts Series E stock conversion ratio.

text.p: TJX Cos Inc said Thursday it has adjusted the conversion ratio on its series E cumulative convertible preferred stock as a result of its previously announced two-for-one common stock split.
The new exchange rate is tied to the November 17, 1998 market price for its common shares, it said.
If the price is at least $9.2625, the conversion rate will be 10.796222 common shares for each preferred share, it said.

If the price is less than $9.2625 but more than $7.71875, the conversion rate will be that number of common shares having a combined value of $100 for each preferred share, it said. If the price is $7.71875 or lower, the conversion rate will be 12.955466 common shares for each preferred share, it said.
The company said the series E preferred shares will automatically convert into shares of common stock at the applicanble exchange rate on November 17, 1998.
Series E shares converted before then will be converted at the rate of 10.796222 common shares for each preferred share, it said.
